body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.65-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2203/folder/13176670/41237099/1041757916 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjniosdjojsdonjs3@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a expense. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Click Report field. 6. Click Create report. 7. Go to Reports > Expenses. 8. Click on the report link in "moved expense to" system message. 9. Click app back button. ## Expected Result: LHN on Reports will not dim. ## Actual Result: LHN on Reports dims after clicking report link and returning via back button on report view ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ce1bd7b3-deef-458b-9057-ff1cac400ab2 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

As an Admin, go to Domains > [domain] > Domain Members 2. Search for the submitter and see what Domain Group they are a member of 3. Go to Groups and set a Preferred workspace for the group and Save 4. As the submitter, on mobile, long tap the Expensify app icon and select SmartScan 5. Tap the green button to take a photo ## Expected Result: I should go directly to the expense details page as my workspace is domain controlled thus locked ## Actual Result: I am taken to the the participant selector page ## Workaround: N/A ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - Pixel 6 - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] PDF downloads of reports silently fail

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** N/A **Reproducible in staging?:** Not yet tested **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/569088 **Issue reported by:** Customers in the linked issue, and @johncschuster **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03SSAQ7P/p1763763948408779 ## Action Performed: 1. User opens a report in New Expensify (Web) 2. Clicks the option to export the report as a PDF 3. A popup appears and spins as if loading 4. After several seconds, the popup closes and the user is returned to the report screen ## Expected Result: The report should be successfully exported as a PDF and downloaded to the user’s device. ## Actual Result: The download fails silently: - No PDF is generated or downloaded - No error message is shown - In some cases, the downloaded PDF is blank - Issue is observed more frequently with larger reports (e.g., 90+ expenses or high receipt count) but also occurs on smaller reports ## Workaround: Yes, a workaround exists. Users have reported successful PDF downloads using Safari when Chrome fails. The Concierge team has communicated this workaround to affected users. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

labels.name: External

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.64-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75113 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoinjsoidjsoijsiodjo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two expenses. 4. Go to Reports > Reports. 5. Select the report from Step 3 via checkbox. → Dropdown button shows "1 selected". 6. Resize the screen to small (or do Step 1 to 5 on Android or iOS app). → Dropdown button shows "2 selected". ## Expected Result: When selecting a report with multiple expenses, dropdown button will show the same amount on wide and small screen. ## Actual Result: When selecting a report with multiple expenses, dropdown button shows different amount on wide and small screen. In Step 5, on wide screen, dropdown button shows the number of report selected - 1 selected. In Step 6, on small screen (or Android and iOS), dropdown button shows the number of expenses selected - 2 selected. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a94bfc95-282a-4210-a367-694392cf5362 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** Vo.2.64-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2173/folder/13176722/41237019/1039336584 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Dreamnitethedragon 4ii@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 phone **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Pre-condition: Import contacts give access 1. Launch app 2. Login with new gmail account 3. Tap fab - start chat 4. Select a chat with imported contact 5. Create split expense and complete the flow 6. Note unexpected error is shown 7. Create an IOU and complete the flow 8. Note no error is shown in details page ## Expected Result: Like IOU, user must be able to create split expense with imported contact. ## Actual Result: Split expense created with imported contact shows unexpected error but user can create IOU successfully. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93b8ff2c-f6f8-4443-aaf8-6b0ac11db124 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
